Class GravBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • GravBody

  • public class GravBody
extends java.lang.Object
    Name: GravBody Purpose: To model a gravitational body that has mass, radius, position, velocity, a name and can be acted upon by other GravBodys
    Version:
    2.2 Date: 11.12.2017
    Author:
    Harry Baker

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      GravBody​()
      Default constructor of GravBody.
      GravBody​(GravBody planet)
      Constructor of GravBody that copies a GravBody by setting every compenent to be the same as the GravBody to be copied.
      GravBody​(java.lang.String a, double x, double y, double z, double i, double j, double k, double M, double d)
      Constructor of GravBody that sets every component seperately.
      GravBody​(java.lang.String a, PhysicsVector p, PhysicsVector u, double M, double d)
      Constructor of GravBody that sets the position and velocity using PhysicsVectors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void beemanPtOne​(PhysicsVector aback, double t)
      Uses the 1st half of the Beeman algorithm to move a body forward by a time-step dt.
      void beemanPtTwo​(PhysicsVector aback, PhysicsVector aIntial, double t)
      Uses the 2nd half of the Beeman algorithm to calculate a body's velocity after it has been moved forward by a time-step dt.
      PhysicsVector calcGrav​(GravBody q)
      Returns the gravitational attraction of one body onto this body, using g = (Gm/r^2)r^ where g is the acceleration due to gravity, G is the Gravitational Constant, m is the mass of the other body, r is the displacement vector between the bodies, and r^ is the unit vector of this displacement vector
      void calcTotBodyAcc​(GravBody q)
      Increases the total acceleration by the acceleration resulting from the gravitational attraction from the other body, using calcGrav.
      void euler​(double t)
      Uses the Euler alogrithm to move a body foward by a time step r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t)dt v(t+dt) = v(t) + a(t)dt Where dt is the time step, t is the intial time of the iteration
      void eulerCramer​(double t)
      Uses the Euler-Cramer alogrithm to move a body foward by a time step v(t+dt) = v(t) + a(t)dt r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t+dt)dt Where dt is the time step, t is the intial time of the iteration
      void eulerRichardson​(GravBody bodymid, double t)
      Uses the Euler-Cramer algorithm with the velocity and acceleration from the mid-point of the iteration v(t+dt) = v(t) + a(t+0.5t)dt r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t+0.5t)dt Where dt is the time step, t is the initial time of the iteration
      PhysicsVector getAngularMomentum​()
      Returns the angular momentum of the body
      double getAngularMomentumMag​()
      Returns the magnitude of the angular momentum of the body
      PhysicsVector getg​()
      Returns the surface gravity of the body
      GravField getgBody​()
      Returns the GravField component of the body
      double getGPE​()
      Returns the GPE of the body
      double getKE​()
      Returns the kinetic energy of the body
      double getMass​()
      Returns the mass of the body
      java.lang.String getName​()
      Returns the name of the body
      PhysicsVector getPosition​()
      Returns the position of the body
      java.lang.String getPositionData​()
      Returns the string holding the position data of the body
      double getPositionX​()
      Returns the x-component of the position of the body
      double getPositionY​()
      Returns the y-component of the position of the body
      double getPositionZ​()
      Returns the z-component of the position of the body

      Returns the radius of the body

      Returns the total acceleration of the body

      Returns the velocity of the body
      double getVelocityX​()
      Returns the x-component of the velocity of the body
      double getVelocityY​()
      Returns the y-component of the velocity of the body
      double getVelocityZ​()
      Returns the z-component of the velocity of the body
      void increaseTotAccBy​(PhysicsVector a)
      Increases the total acceleration of the body by a PhysicsVector
      void printBody​()
      Prints the position and velocity of the body
      void printBodyChar​()
      Prints the characteristics of the body
      void setAngularMomentum​()
      Sets the angular momentum of the body using L = r x mv
      void setBody​(double x, double y, double z, double i, double j, double k)
      Sets the body's position and velocity components seperately
      void setBody​(GravBody planet)
      Sets a GravBody's parameters to another GravBody's
      void setBody​(PhysicsVector p, PhysicsVector u)
      Sets the body's position and velocity using PhysicsVectors
      void setGPE​(GravBody q)
      Sets the GPE of the body with respect to another body using GPE = -GMm/r Where G is the gravitational constant, M is the mass of the other body m is the mass of this body, r is the displacement vector between them.
      void setKE​()
      Sets the kinetic energy of the body using KE = 0.5*m*v^2
      void setPosition​(double x, double y, double z)
      Sets the body's position components seperately
      void setPosition​(PhysicsVector p)
      Sets the body's position using a PhysicsVector
      void setPositionData​()
      Formats the positionData string for easy plotting of a GravBody's trajectory

      Sets the total acceleration components of the body seperately

      Sets the total acceleration of the body using a PhysicsVector
      void setVelocity​(double i, double j, double k)
      Sets the body's velocity components seperately
      void setVelocity​(PhysicsVector u)
      Sets the body's velocity using a PhysicsVector
      void verletPtOne​(double t)
      Implements the first part of the Verlet alogrithm to move a body foward by a time step.
      void verletPtTwo​(PhysicsVector intialTotA, double t)
      Implements the last part of the Verlet algorithm to move a body foward by a time step.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GravBody

        public GravBody​()
        Default constructor of GravBody. Sets the position and velocity to 0 and the mass and radius to 1. Names the body "Body".

      • GravBody

        public GravBody​(java.lang.String a,
                double x,
                double y,
                double z,
                double i,
                double j,
                double k,
                double M,
                double d)
        Constructor of GravBody that sets every component seperately. Calculates the surface gravity and kE. Sets gPE and totala to 0 as this requires other GravBodys to calculate this.
        Parameters:
        a - Set to the name of the body
        x - Set to the x-component of the position of the body
        y - Set to the y-component of the position of the body
        z - Set to the z-component of the position of the body
        i - Set to the x-component of the velocity of the body
        j - Set to the y-component of the velocity of the body
        k - Set to the z-component of the velocity of the body
        M - Set to the mass of the body
        d - Set to the radius of the body

      • GravBody

        public GravBody​(java.lang.String a,
                PhysicsVector p,
                PhysicsVector u,
                double M,
                double d)
        Constructor of GravBody that sets the position and velocity using PhysicsVectors. Calculates the surface gravity and kE. Sets gPE and totala to 0 as this requires other GravBodys to calculate this.
        Parameters:
        a - Set to the name of the body
        p - Set to the position of the body
        u - Set to the velocity of the body
        M - Set to the mass of the body
        d - Set to the radius of the body

      • GravBody

        public GravBody​(GravBody planet)
        Constructor of GravBody that copies a GravBody by setting every compenent to be the same as the GravBody to be copied.
        Parameters:
        planet - GravBody to be copied

        public void setTotAcc​(double a,
                      double b,
                      double c)
        Sets the total acceleration components of the body seperately

        b - Set to the y-component of the total acceleration of the body
        c - Set to the z-component of the total acceleration of the body

        Sets the total acceleration of the body using a PhysicsVector
        Parameters:
        a - New total acceleration

      • calcGrav

        public PhysicsVector calcGrav​(GravBody q)
        Returns the gravitational attraction of one body onto this body, using g = (Gm/r^2)r^ where g is the acceleration due to gravity, G is the Gravitational Constant, m is the mass of the other body, r is the displacement vector between the bodies, and r^ is the unit vector of this displacement vector
        Parameters:
        q - GravBody effecting this GravBody
        Returns:
        Acceleration due to gravity on this body from body q, a

      • setKE

        public void setKE​()
        Sets the kinetic energy of the body using KE = 0.5*m*v^2

      • setGPE

        public void setGPE​(GravBody q)
        Sets the GPE of the body with respect to another body using GPE = -GMm/r Where G is the gravitational constant, M is the mass of the other body m is the mass of this body, r is the displacement vector between them.
        Parameters:
        q - Body GPE is being calculated with respect to

      • setPositionData

        public void setPositionData​()
        Formats the positionData string for easy plotting of a GravBody's trajectory

      • calcTotBodyAcc

        public void calcTotBodyAcc​(GravBody q)
        Increases the total acceleration by the acceleration resulting from the gravitational attraction from the other body, using calcGrav.
        Parameters:
        q - GravBody attracting this GravBody

      • increaseTotAccBy

        public void increaseTotAccBy​(PhysicsVector a)
        Increases the total acceleration of the body by a PhysicsVector
        Parameters:
        a - Increases the total acceleration by this PhysicsVector

      • euler

        public void euler​(double t)
        Uses the Euler alogrithm to move a body foward by a time step r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t)dt v(t+dt) = v(t) + a(t)dt Where dt is the time step, t is the intial time of the iteration
        Parameters:
        t - Time step of the iteration

      • eulerCramer

        public void eulerCramer​(double t)
        Uses the Euler-Cramer alogrithm to move a body foward by a time step v(t+dt) = v(t) + a(t)dt r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t+dt)dt Where dt is the time step, t is the intial time of the iteration
        Parameters:
        t - Time step of the iteration

      • eulerRichardson

        public void eulerRichardson​(GravBody bodymid,
                            double t)
        Uses the Euler-Cramer algorithm with the velocity and acceleration from the mid-point of the iteration v(t+dt) = v(t) + a(t+0.5t)dt r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t+0.5t)dt Where dt is the time step, t is the initial time of the iteration
        Parameters:
        bodymid - Copy of the body at the mid-point of the iteration
        t - Time step of the iteration

      • verletPtOne

        public void verletPtOne​(double t)
        Implements the first part of the Verlet alogrithm to move a body foward by a time step. r(t+dt) = r(t) + v(t)dt + 0.5a(t)(dt)^2 Where dt is the time step, t is the intial time of the iteration
        Parameters:
        t - Time step of the iteration

      • verletPtTwo

        public void verletPtTwo​(PhysicsVector intialTotA,
                        double t)
        Implements the last part of the Verlet algorithm to move a body foward by a time step. a_n+1 has to be calculated through SolarSystem v(t+dt) = v(t) + 0.5*(a(t+dt) + a(t))dt Where dt is the time step, t is the intial time of the iteration
        Parameters:
        t - Time step of the iteration
        intialTotA - Average acceleration of body over time-step

      • beemanPtOne

        public void beemanPtOne​(PhysicsVector aback,
                        double t)
        Uses the 1st half of the Beeman algorithm to move a body forward by a time-step dt. r(t+dt) = x(t) + v(t)dt + (2/3)*a(t)*(dt)^2 - (1/6)*a(t-dt)*(dt)^2 Where dt is the time-step, t is the intial time of the iteration
        Parameters:
        aback - Acceleration on body at time t-dt
        t - Time-step of iteration

      • beemanPtTwo

        public void beemanPtTwo​(PhysicsVector aback,
                        PhysicsVector aIntial,
                        double t)
        Uses the 2nd half of the Beeman algorithm to calculate a body's velocity after it has been moved forward by a time-step dt. v(t+dt) = v(t) + (5/12)*a(t+dt) + (2/3)*a(t)dt - (1/12)*a(t-dt)dt Where dt is the time-step, t is the intial time of the iteration
        Parameters:
        aback - Acceleration on body at time t-dt
        aIntial - Acceleration on body at start of iteration
        t - Time-step of iteration
